snippet: Unless the Supreme Court intervenes, California can begin enforcing the law barring consideration of race or sex in affirmative action programs on Thursday, a Federal appeals court ruled today.    The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth C...
lead_paragraph: Unless the Supreme Court intervenes, California can begin enforcing the law barring consideration of race or sex in affirmative action programs on Thursday, a Federal appeals court ruled today. The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit denied a request by civil rights groups to suspend the effect of its ruling upholding the law during an appeal to the Supreme Court.
abstract: Federal appeals court clears California to begin enforcing law barring consideration of race or sex in affirmative action programs; American Civil Liberties Union to ask Supreme Court to stay ruling while appeal is pending (S)
